A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: 70% of Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a five star film. Not a single shot is meaningless nor a single beat wasted nor a single line unnecessary. However\, the other 30% is the issue. The Last Jedi is scared to take risks: it is scared to spend it’s second act without action; it is scared the audience will get bored without a laugh and\, most importantly;it is scared it will lose the audience if characters meet their end\, however fitting. For this reason\, the other 30% of Episode VIII is a childish\, cliche mess full of Deus Ex Machinas and flat characters. There is a flawless movie in there somewhere\, but first you need to trim the fat.
